name: Iron Farm
description: Build an automatic iron farm using villagers and golems
tips: Needs 3 villagers, 3 beds, and zombie scaring mechanic. Simple designs produce 300+ iron/hour

name: Gold Farm (Overworld Portal)
description: Build a gold farm using nether portal spawning mechanics
tips: Zombified piglins spawn near portals in the overworld. Less efficient but safer than nether farms

name: Gold Farm (Nether Roof)
description: Build a massive gold farm on the nether roof
tips: Extremely efficient but requires nether roof access and large building area

name: XP Farm (Mob Grinder)
description: Build a dark room mob spawner for XP and drops
tips: Build high in the sky or underground. Water channels funnel mobs to a kill chamber

name: Enderman Farm
description: Build an enderman XP farm in The End
tips: Use an endermite in a minecart to lure endermen. Best XP farm in the game

name: Guardian Farm
description: Convert an ocean monument into a guardian farm
tips: Drain the monument first. Great for prismarine, sea lanterns, and XP

name: Villager Trading Hall
description: Build a hall with organized villagers for all useful trades
tips: Include librarians for enchantments, toolsmiths, and a farmer for emeralds

name: Automatic Crop Farm
description: Build a villager-powered automatic wheat/carrot/potato farm
tips: Farmer villagers harvest and throw crops. Use hoppers under composters to collect

name: Sugar Cane Farm
description: Build an automatic sugar cane farm with observers
tips: Observer detects growth, piston breaks cane. Essential for books and rockets

name: Bamboo Farm
description: Build a fast automatic bamboo farm
tips: Bamboo is the fastest growing plant. Great for scaffolding and smelting fuel

name: Tree Farm
description: Build a semi-automatic or fully automatic tree farm
tips: TNT duping tree farms are most efficient. Simpler designs use pistons

name: Wool Farm
description: Build an automatic sheep wool farm using observers and shears
tips: Dispenser with shears triggers on observer. Sheep regrow wool after eating grass

name: Honey/Bee Farm
description: Build an automatic honey and honeycomb farm
tips: Use campfire under hive, dispenser harvests safely. Useful for honey blocks and candles

name: Slime Farm
description: Build a slime farm in a slime chunk
tips: Find slime chunks using chunkbase. Build below Y=40. Iron golems can lure slimes

name: Witch Farm
description: Convert a witch hut into an automatic witch farm
tips: Only witches spawn in witch huts. Great for redstone, glowstone, and gunpowder

name: Wither Skeleton Farm
description: Build a wither skeleton farm in a nether fortress
tips: Wither skeletons only spawn on nether brick. Consider building a perimeter

name: Blaze Farm
description: Build a blaze farm around a nether fortress spawner
tips: Encase the spawner and use funneling. Blazes must be killed by player for XP and rods

name: Piglin Bartering Station
description: Build an automatic piglin bartering station
tips: Use dispensers to throw gold ingots. Great for ender pearls, quartz, and gravel

name: Raid Farm
description: Build an automatic raid farm for emeralds and totems
tips: One of the best farms in the game. Produces emeralds, totems, and enchanted gear

name: Creeper Farm
description: Build a creeper-only farm for gunpowder
tips: Use trapdoors on ceiling so only creepers can spawn. Essential for rockets

name: Music Disc Farm
description: Build a farm where skeletons kill creepers for music discs
tips: Trap a skeleton and funnel creepers past it. Skeleton arrows must deal killing blow

name: Shulker Farm
description: Build a shulker shell farm using shulker duplication
tips: Shulkers can duplicate when hit by another shulker's projectile. Renewable shells!

name: Bulk Storage System
description: Build a large storage system for mass item storage
tips: Use shulker box loaders for easy bulk storage. Categorize by item type

name: Item Sorter
description: Build a redstone item sorting system
tips: Standard design uses hopper with 1 item + 21 filler items. Overflow protection is important

name: Nether Hub with Ice Roads
description: Build a nether hub with boat-on-ice travel tunnels
tips: Blue ice is fastest. Build at Y=120 in nether for easy roof access if possible

name: Elytra Launcher
description: Build an elytra launch system using water, slime, or TNT
tips: Riptide trident in water or slime block launchers work well

name: AFK Fish Farm
description: Build an automatic fishing farm (check if still working in current version)
tips: Treasure loot was nerfed in 1.16. Still works for fish and some enchanted books

name: 2x2 Piston Door
description: Build a hidden 2x2 piston door
tips: Simple hipster door design. Great for secret entrances

name: 3x3 Piston Door
description: Build a flush 3x3 piston door
tips: Requires sticky pistons and careful timing. Many tutorials available

name: Vault Door (4x4 or larger)
description: Build a large vault-style piston door
tips: Very complex redstone. Consider using slime block flying machines

name: Automatic Smelter Array
description: Build a multi-furnace automatic smelting system
tips: Use blast furnaces for ores, smokers for food. Bamboo makes excellent fuel

name: Full Beacon Pyramid
description: Build a complete 4-layer beacon pyramid with all effects
tips: Iron is most practical. 164 blocks per pyramid, 6 beacons for all effects

name: Mob Switch
description: Build a mob switch for peaceful-mode-like spawning control
tips: Fill mob cap with named mobs in lazy chunks. Prevents hostile spawning worldwide

name: Perimeter
description: Dig a massive perimeter for technical builds
tips: Use TNT dupers and world eaters. Needed for max-efficiency farms

name: Cobblestone Generator
description: Build an automatic cobblestone generator
tips: Water meets lava source = cobble. Add pistons for automation

name: Basalt Generator
description: Build an automatic basalt generator
tips: Lava flows onto soul soil with blue ice adjacent = basalt

name: Obsidian Farm
description: Build an automatic obsidian generator
tips: Wither cage breaking or end platform reset methods. Very technical

name: End Platform Reset Farm
description: Farm using the End spawn platform regeneration
tips: Platform resets when player enters End. Useful for obsidian

name: Concrete Maker
description: Build an automatic concrete powder to concrete converter
tips: Drop concrete powder into water, collect with hoppers or break manually

name: Snow Farm
description: Build an automatic snow farm using snow golems
tips: Snow golem on hopper. Pumpkin required for creation

name: Pumpkin/Melon Farm
description: Build an automatic pumpkin and melon farm
tips: Observers detect growth, pistons break stems. Good for trading with farmers

name: Kelp Farm
description: Build an automatic kelp farm for dried kelp fuel
tips: Dried kelp blocks are decent furnace fuel. Easy to automate

name: Cactus Farm
description: Build an automatic cactus farm for green dye
tips: Cactus breaks when block placed adjacent. Also useful for XP smelting

name: Flower Farm
description: Build a bone meal based flower farm
tips: Dispenser with bone meal on grass. Different biomes give different flowers

name: Moss Farm
description: Build an automatic moss block farm for bone meal
tips: Moss spreads with bone meal. Great for renewable stone and bone meal loops

name: Copper Aging Chamber
description: Build a chamber for aging copper blocks
tips: Copper ages faster when not near other copper. Use wax to preserve desired state

name: Villager Breeder
description: Build an automatic villager breeding system
tips: Villagers need beds and food to breed. Use excess beds and a farmer

name: Zombie Villager Converter
description: Build a station for curing zombie villagers efficiently
tips: Multiple cures stack discounts. Combine with trading hall for 1 emerald trades

name: Drowned Farm
description: Build a drowned farm for tridents and nautilus shells
tips: Convert zombies to drowned in water, or farm naturally in ocean

name: Phantom Farm
description: Build a phantom farm for phantom membranes
tips: Don't sleep for 3+ days. Use cats to scare them into kill chamber

name: Squid/Glow Squid Farm
description: Build a farm for ink sacs and glow ink sacs
tips: Squid spawn in water. Glow squids need total darkness. Use magma blocks to kill

name: Hoglin Farm
description: Build a hoglin farm for porkchops and leather
tips: Hoglins flee from warped fungus. Use breeding for renewable farm

name: Fox Sweet Berry Farm
description: Build a farm using foxes to harvest sweet berries
tips: Foxes pick up and eat berries. Use hoppers to collect drops

name: Wither Rose Farm
description: Build a farm to generate wither roses using the Wither
tips: Wither killing mobs drops wither roses. Trap wither and funnel chickens

name: Minecart Rail System
description: Build a comprehensive minecart transport network
tips: Powered rails every 30 blocks on flat ground. Use gold farm for rails

name: Complete Enchanting Setup
description: Build an enchanting room with 15 bookshelves and anvil station
tips: 15 bookshelves for max enchants. Include grindstone for disenchanting

name: Automatic Brewing Station
description: Build a brewing setup with automatic ingredient loading
tips: Hoppers can load ingredients into brewing stands. Make a potion on demand system

name: Allay Item Sorter
description: Build an item sorter using allays for unstackable items
tips: Allays can sort unstackable items that hoppers cannot. Use note blocks

name: Froglight Farm
description: Build a farm producing all froglight colors
tips: Transport frogs to nether, feed them tiny magma cubes from a slime/magma cube farm

name: Sculk XP Farm
description: Build a farm using sculk catalysts for XP storage
tips: Sculk catalysts spread sculk when mobs die nearby. Break sculk for stored XP
